skill.name: saga-orchestration
skill.description: Implement saga patterns for distributed transactions and cross-aggregate workflows. Use when coordinating multi-step business processes, handling compensating transactions, or managing long-running workflows.
skill.summary: Implement saga patterns for distributed transactions and cross-aggregate workflows. Use when coordin...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns detected. The content is documentation and code templates without filesystem or network access.

content.user_title: Design saga workflows for distributed services
content.value_statement: Distributed workflows fail when steps do not coordinate or roll back cleanly. This skill provides clear saga patterns and templates to orchestrate steps and compensations.
actual_capabilities: Explain choreography versus orchestration saga models
Define saga execution states and transitions
Provide a base saga orchestrator template in Python
Show an order fulfillment saga with compensations
Provide a choreography based saga example
Add timeout handling to saga steps
limitations: No production ready code or libraries are included
Messaging, storage, and scheduler integrations are placeholders
Examples are Python focused and not framework specific

use_cases.title: Order fulfillment flow
use_cases.description: Design a multi service order workflow with compensation steps and failure handling.

use_cases.title: Long running approvals
use_cases.description: Model approval workflows with timeouts and rollback behavior.

use_cases.title: Saga pattern review
use_cases.description: Align teams on orchestration versus choreography tradeoffs.

prompt_templates.title: Basic saga design
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a simple saga for a checkout flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a saga orchestration for checkout with inventory, payment, and shipping steps. Include compensations and state transitions.

prompt_templates.title: Add timeouts
prompt_templates.scenario: Add timeout behavior to an existing saga
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend a saga orchestrator with per step timeouts and failure handling. Describe how timeouts trigger compensation.

prompt_templates.title: Choreography option
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a choreography based saga for order processing and list event names and handlers.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced failure plan
prompt_templates.scenario: Handle partial failures in long workflows
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a saga plan for a multi stage onboarding flow with retries, compensations, and audit logging guidance.

output_examples.input: Design an order fulfillment saga with compensations and timeouts.
output: Steps: reserve inventory, process payment, create shipment, send confirmation.
Compensations: release inventory, refund payment, cancel shipment.
Timeout policy: fail step after 5 minutes and start compensation.

best_practices: Make steps idempotent for safe retries
Design compensations for every irreversible action
Use correlation IDs for cross service tracing
anti_patterns: Tightly couple services with direct calls

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is platform neutral and works with any assistant that can follow design templates.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and templates, not runnable services, storage, or messaging implementations.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my message bus?
faq.answer: Map the publish and subscribe calls to your bus API and persist saga state in your storage layer.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It contains static documentation and example templates only.

faq.question: What should I check if steps never complete?
faq.answer: Verify event delivery, saga state persistence, and timeout scheduling.

faq.question: How does this compare to choreography only?
faq.answer: Orchestration centralizes control, while choreography spreads logic across services and relies on events.
